WhyTheFace 21 January 2011 10:30 AM The question is, is the moron called Michael Gove doing anything to make it better? He's making massive changes, but is there a single one that will improve children's education, as oppossed to conforming to his ideological view of what will improve their education but actually make everyone go backwards? Publishing the Bill on Thursday, Mr Michael Gove said: There are areas of Ofsted inspections, such as community cohesion or regulations Michael Governing what students bring in in their lunchboxes at lunchtime, which are entirely peripheral. "One of the problems with Ofsted inspections is that they are asked to inspect and measure for things which, by definition, are hard to judge and not central to what schools are about. The Bill hands more control to the Education Secretary to intervene in failing schools. Mr Michael Gove insisted that under-achieving academies will not be exempt from this.
